# A Rundown

--

.center2[***(Statistical) Power*** is the probability of avoiding a Type II error]

--

# Terminology is Important!

Let's begin with this fantastic tweet from Dr. Richard Morey

```{r tweet-from-dsquintana}
include_tweet("https://twitter.com/richarddmorey/status/1076204872091893760")
```

--

Power is by far one of the most misunderstood concepts in that a lot of people think they know it but simply miss the point. In this session, you'll be introduced to the basic premise of statistical power and how to actually conduct various types of power analyses. While I would love to rant about how people who should know better frequently misuse and perpetuate misinformation about power, this is not the proper forum. However if you are interested, please take a look at Dr. Morey's follow-up to the above tweet by clicking on the image below. He does an absolutely excellent job describing this high level concept to a general audience who have a very basic understanding of statistics.

<a href="https://towardsdatascience.com/why-you-shouldnt-say-this-study-is-underpowered-627f002ddf35">

</a>
